Find out what you can expect!  The following shows one possible timeline for completion of the Minor in Life Science Visualization. You may elect to shorten or lengthen your timeline with your advisor to best fit with your other courses.  Semesters can be in either fall or spring.       Year 1    Year 1    Year 2         Semester 1    Semester 2       These pre/co-requisite courses may be taken at the same time as the courses in Semester 2. Semesters can be in either fall or spring.   Pre/Co-requisite Courses        BIOS 100  Biology of Cells and Organisms  5 hours    ART 112  Introduction to Drawing  4 hours          Semesters can be in either fall or spring. You will need to complete required course, BVIS 250, and complete one of the first elective Life Science Visualization courses.   Required Life Science Visualization Courses        BVIS 250  Life Science Visualization Techniques I  3 hours      Elective Life Science Visualization Course (choose at least 1)        BVIS 260  Biological Illustration Techniques  3 hours    BVIS 270  Constructing the Anatomical Figure  3 hours             Semester 3    Semester 4       You will need to complete a portfolio review for applying to the minor. Once you have taken some of your Life Science Visualization courses, this may be a good time to complete that task with the LSV faculty to demonstrate basic drawing competency.  You will need to take Life Science Visualization Techniques II as well as one additional science elective listed below.     Required courses        BVIS 251  Life Science Visualization Techniques II  3 hours      Elective Science Course (choose at least 1)        KN 251  Human Physiological Anatomy  5 hours    BIOS 272  Comparative Vertebrate Anatomy and Physiology  5 hours          You will need to take one final Life Science Visualization elective course before completing the minor.   Elective Life Science Visualization Course (choose at least 1)        BVIS 320  Life Science Animation, Storytelling, and Storyboarding  3 hours    BVIS 325  Digital Sculpting for Life Science Illustration  3 hours    BVIS 330  Serious Games for Life Science Education  3 hours    BVIS 335  Visual Strategies for Health and Life Science Communication  3 hours              Biomedical and Health Information Sciences           Admissions and Programs          BS in Health Information Management          What to Expect    Before You Apply    Applying          Transferring from another UIC program      After You Apply      Minor in Life Science Visualization          What to Expect    Applying      MS in Biomedical Visualization          What to Expect    Before You Apply    Applying    After You Apply    Meet Our Students          Class of 2020    Class of 2021        MS in Health Informatics    PhD in Biomedical and Health Informatics          What to Expect    Before You Apply    Applying    After You Apply    Faculty      Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Health Information Management    Post-Master’s Certificate in Health Informatics    Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Health Informatics      News    Calendar    Directory    Contact
